thread.title: Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0
thread.title_full: Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0

title: Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0
text:
Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0 Ovechkin missed the game because of personal reasons. Post to Facebook Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0 Ovechkin missed the game because of personal reasons.  //on.wusa9.com/1RGwOrf   Join the Conversation To   Jones has second straight shutout, Sharks top Caps, 5-0 Associated Press, AP 11:31 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 Oct 13, 2015; Washington, DC, USA; San Jose Sharks center Tommy Wingels (57) and Washington Capitals right wing T.J. Oshie (77) battle for the puck in the third period at Verizon Center. The Sharks won 5-0. Mandatory Credit: Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Geoff Burke, Geoff Burke-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WASHINGTON (AP) - Martin Jones made 31 saves for his second straight shutout and the San Jose Sharks took advantage of Alex Ovechkin's absence from Washington's lineup to beat the Capitals 5-0 on Tuesday night. 
The Sharks improved to 3-0-0 and have outscored their opponents 12-1. Jones allowed a goal on the first shot he faced this season, but has blanked opponents for the following 178 minutes, 11 seconds. 
Matt Nieto and Chris Tierney each had a goal and an assist, and Joe Thornton, Mike Brown and Tomas Hertl added goals. 
Ovechkin missed the game because of personal reasons. The Capitals sent out a note on Twitter about 35 minutes before the game saying the Russian star would not play. They confirmed earlier in the day that the left wing did not take part in the morning skate, and coach Barry Trotz said he would be a game-time decision. 
Ovechkin had a goal and an assist Saturday night in Washington's season-opening victory over New Jersey. Read or Share this story: http://on.wusa9.com/1RGwOrf TOP VIDEOS
